intro: Chascolytrum monandrum, commonly known as the narrowleaf yarrow, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its narrow, linear leaves and clusters of small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It is often found in regions with temperate to subtropical climates. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural studies.
